png

Class PngChunkTEXT

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.PngChunk
      • png.PngChunkTEXT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextualChunk

    public class PngChunkTEXT
extends PngChunk
implements TextualChunk
    Represents a tEXt chunk in a PNG file, which stores original textual data. This chunk contains a keyword and associated text string, both encoded in Latin-1. It extends PngChunk to provide decoding of the textual content into a TextEntry.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • PngChunkTEXT

        public PngChunkTEXT(long length,
                    byte[] typeBytes,
                    int crc32,
                    byte[] data)
        Constructs a PngChunkTEXT instance with the specified metadata.

        According to the PNG specification:

        • Keyword: Latin-1 string (1â€“79 bytes)
        • Null Separator: 1 byte
        • Text: Latin-1 string (0 or more bytes)
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the chunk's data field (excluding type and CRC)
        typeBytes - the raw 4-byte chunk type
        crc32 - the CRC value read from the file
        data - raw chunk data

        Checks whether this chunk contains a specific textual keyword.
        Specified by:
        hasKeyword in interface TextualChunk
        Parameters:
        keyword - the TextKeyword to search for
        Returns:
        true if found, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified keyword is null

      • toTextEntry

        public java.util.Optional<TextEntry> toTextEntry()
        Extracts a keyword-text pair from the tEXt chunk.
        Specified by:
        toTextEntry in interface TextualChunk
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the extracted keyword and text as a TextEntry instance if present, otherwise, Optional.empty()
